Stores the identifications of buttons.

member.summary: Select simulated or data base stored data

member.name: M:FoldingTable._Default.odsStores_ObjectCreating(System.Object,System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceEventArgs)
member.summary: Instantiates the business logic layer object, in order to fill the main grid

member.name: M:FoldingTable._Default.odsStores_ObjectDisposing(System.Object,System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDisposingEventArgs)
member.summary:
This method is called when the object odsStores releases memory used by the business logic layer object.
If some error was found when reading from database, this method will show the error message.

member.name: M:FoldingTable._Default.gridStores_RowDataBound(System.Object,System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowEventArgs)
member.summary: Called for each row of the main grid, calls a method to prepare the details

member.name: M:FoldingTable._Default.gridStores_DataBound(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
Called after the main grid was bound
Will create a Javascrip array, used to enable/disable the buttons
See function EnableExpandButtons in ExpandPanel.js

member.name: M:FoldingTable._Default.InsertModelsRow(System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow,FoldingTable.Store)
member.summary:
Prepares to show the top models for one store.
A new hidden row is inserted below the current row in the grid.
That row will have only one cell, spanned to the entire row.
Inside the new row, a panel is inserted as a simple HTML 'fieldset', just to show a border and some header.
Inside the fieldset, a new panel is inserted. That panel will be filled with details when the user click the button.
member.param: One row from the main grid
